p: Naturally, skin provide mechanical barrier to the body against the invasion by microorganisms through protective keratinous surface, which allows the removal of microorganisms via sloughing off keratinocytes and acidic sebaceous secretions [ 1]. However, break in the skin in case of surgery, cuts, puncture, decubitus ulcer, animal or insect bites, thorn and needle pricks, or burns can result in skin infections [ 2]. The spectrum of infection ranges from asymptomatic colonization to bacteraemia, fungemia, and death [ 3]. Common skin infections caused by microorganisms include carbuncles, furuncles, cellulitis, impetigo, boils, folliculitis, ringworm, acne, and foot odor [ 4].
